intro: Erigeron pauper, commonly known as the poorweed, is a flowering plant native to North America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as prairies and rocky soils. It produces small, white or pale blue flowers that bloom in the summer months. Erigeron pauper is often found in disturbed areas and is considered a hardy, drought-tolerant species.
